vision.notes: Presence of vision is inferred due to the inclusion of Tetracha virginica (Virginia metallic tiger beetle) in the family, which is known to have vision. However, the extent of visual reliance and capability across all 40,000+ species is unknown, so this is a generalization. Ground beetles are primarily nocturnal and may have reduced visual acuity in some species.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely a common means of detecting prey and mates, given their carnivorous and diverse diets. This is inferred based on general insect biology.

mechanoreception.notes: Tactile senses via antennae and other body parts are crucial for navigating the environment and detecting prey, given they are ground beetles. Inferred based on habitat and general insect biology.
